text:
The U.S. Department of Justice is seeking to reinstate the death penalty for the man convicted of carrying out the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing.

“We will take it up to the Supreme Court,” Attorney General William Barr said. https://t.co/vp8rv7inwV

name: chicagotribune
text: A Northfield woman was charged with battery following a confrontation Sunday in Winnetka over whether a group of people were allowed to sit on a public pier. Video of the encounter spread widely online. https://t.co/sDeQtumOQh

text: Joe Biden is poised to accept the Democratic presidential nomination during the final night of the virtual DNC. Watch it live here: https://t.co/P4fQ4mRuIe

text: Here’s a rundown of how developing a coronavirus vaccine works and where things stand with research on the most promising candidates. https://t.co/YdR0if9ZWL

text:
QAnon, the sprawling and baseless internet conspiracy theory, came up at President Donald Trump's news conference on Wednesday. So what, exactly, is it?

text: “It is gut-wrenching.” Family shares memories of woman killed in downtown Chicago by an SUV driver who hit her, then circled the block and hit her again. https://t.co/VrgiR1Uojt

text: Illinois U.S. Sen. Tammy Duckworth seized her high-profile moment at the Democratic National Convention on Thursday night by launching an offensive against President Donald Trump for politicizing the military and displaying failed leadership abroad https://t.co/q2EUfT51da

text: During his DNC speech, Pete Buttigieg pointed to the progress on gay rights during his 38-year lifetime as reason to be optimistic that the change needed to create an “America where everyone belongs” remains possible https://t.co/ififzCt00Y
